findings.title: MT - Mint Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens if misused.

findings.title: ST - Stop Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop selling transactions for all users excluding the owner and may take advantage of it by setting the `taxFee` to a high value percent, effectively converting the contract into a honeypot.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceed Limit Fees Manipulation
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25% by calling the `setSellTaxPercent` function with a high percentage value, and also can stop selling transactions for all users excluding the owner by setting the `taxFee` to a high value percent.

findings.title: L01 - Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Detected missing events for critical arithmetic parameters. There are functions that have no event emitted, so it is difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code elimination is necessary to remove unreachable or redundant code.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Variables defined in local scope have same name as upper scoped variables.
